comments.text:
In bug 663253, I removed the "browser.offline" pref from Firefox 7. That was used to persist an user-initiated offline mode across sessions.

So Chatzilla should stop getting and setting that pref:
http://mxr.mozilla.org/comm-central/search?string=%22browser.offline%22&find=irc

Just get and set client.iosvc.offline instead.

comments.text:
Correct, nobody is getting or setting the browser.offline pref except Chatzilla...

You can ignore the network.online pref as well. When that pref is *locked*, Firefox and SeaMonkey disable their "Work Offline" UI:
5963     var offlineLocked = gPrefService.prefIsLocked("network.online");
5964     if (offlineLocked)
5965       this._uiElement.setAttribute("disabled", "true");
Getting or setting the pref value is useless anyhow.
See http://mxr.mozilla.org/comm-central/search?string=network.online&find=&findi=&filter=%5E%5B%5E%5C0%5D*%24&hitlimit=&tree=comm-central

You already observe "network:offline-status-changed" and get and set iosvc.offline. That's necessary and sufficient.

I guess you can remove updateOfflineFromPref and updatePrefFromOffline altogether.

How can I do that now?

user_pref("browser.offline", true);
to start the browser offline. I use that to prevent the 50 open tabs to load all pages when firefox starts.

(In reply to Jens Martin Schlatter from comment #3)
> How can I do that now?

Preferences -> General -> Startup -> "Don't load tabs until selected"
